replication_study.hypothesis: Across country-year observations, entrepreneurship rate is negatively associated with median age after adjusting for year fixed effects.

data_plan.source_type: Assembled survey-based country-year dataset derived from Global Entrepreneurship Monitor (GEM) combined with demographic statistics; provided as CSV.
data_plan.wave_or_subset: Intended to mirror GEM 2001–2010 coverage per post_registration.json; exact years will be taken from the year variable present in replication_data_mkk9.csv.
data_plan.sample_size: To be computed from replication_data_mkk9.csv after filtering non-missing median_age; expected on the order of several hundred country-years.

qualification.explanation: The CSV includes the necessary operational variables used in the original study’s reduced-form specification as evidenced by the paired Stata .do script: entrepreneurship rate (dependent), median_age (key predictor), year fixed effects, and country identifiers with analytic weights. This enables a direct test of the focal claim using independent compiled data consistent with original sources.
qualification.similarity_to_original: Per post_registration.json, the original used GEM country-year entrepreneurship rates and demographic measures including median age with year dummies and country-clustered SEs. The provided .do script REPEntireDataset2_Country_Year_Entre_Regression.do runs: reg entrepreneurship median_age i.year [aw=cy_cell], cluster(country) on replication_data_mkk9.csv, directly mirroring the original specification (post_registration.json method/models).
qualification.deviation_from_original: The replication focuses on the median_age specification without the broader macro controls listed in post_registration.json (e.g., log GDP per capita, startup costs). Also, the dataset is a prepared CSV rather than raw GEM/IDB merges, so variable definitions rely on preprocessing embedded upstream. This makes it an independent compiled sample rather than the full multi-source reconstruction.

data_plan.notes: The .do script drops rows with median_age == "NA" then destrings; we will implement equivalent cleaning in Python (filter non-numeric/NA median_age, cast to float). The .do uses analytic weights cy_cell, year fixed effects i.year, and clusters by country. We will reproduce these via statsmodels WLS with robust covariance clustered at country and year dummies. All paths will use /app/data. If any of the required columns (entrepreneurship, median_age, country, year, cy_cell) are missing or differently named, we will map to the correct names or request a corrected dataset.

steps: Clean variables: drop observations with missing/non-numeric median_age; ensure entrepreneurship, country, year, and cy_cell are present and correctly typed.
Construct year fixed effects (one-hot or categorical) excluding one baseline.
Estimate OLS/WLS of entrepreneurship on median_age and year fixed effects with analytic weights cy_cell and country-clustered robust standard errors.
Report coefficient on median_age with robust t-stats and p-values; compare direction and magnitude to the original claim.
Optionally compute the marginal effect corresponding to a one SD decrease in median_age using sample SD to contextualize against the 2.5 percentage point benchmark.
planned_method.models: Weighted least squares (equivalent to Stata [aw]) with year fixed effects and country-clustered robust covariance. Implementation via statsmodels: WLS with weights=cy_cell and cov_type='cluster', cov_kwds={'groups': country}.
planned_method.control_variables: Year dummies only, as per the provided .do script for the focal test.

planned_estimation_and_test.estimation: Coefficient on median_age in the country-year regression with year fixed effects and analytic weights.
planned_estimation_and_test.test: t-test on the median_age coefficient using country-clustered standard errors; two-sided at alpha=0.05.

planned_method.missing_data_handling: Listwise deletion for missing or non-numeric median_age and entrepreneurship; rows with missing country, year, or cy_cell will be dropped.
planned_method.inference_criteria: Primary: median_age coefficient is negative and statistically significant at 5% level with country-clustered SEs. Secondary: effect magnitude consistent with a notably negative association; optionally contextualize via 1 SD shift in median_age.

files.replicate_median_age_effect__py.py: Python translation of REPEntireDataset2_Country_Year_Entre_Regression.do. Reads /app/data/original/18/0112_gpt5/replication_data/replication_data_mkk9.csv, cleans median_age, fits WLS entrepreneurship ~ median_age + C(year) with weights cy_cell and country-clustered SEs. Saves regression table and summary to /app/data outputs (CSV and TXT).

codebase.notes: All I/O constrained to /app/data. statsmodels will be used for WLS and clustered covariance. If cy_cell behaves as analytic weights differently, results may differ slightly from Stata; we will document any discrepancies. Random seeds not applicable.

instructions: Inspect the saved outputs in /app/data: median_age_regression_results.csv (coefficients, SEs, t-stats, p-values) and median_age_regression_summary.txt (model summary).
comparison_metrics: Sign and significance of the median_age coefficient (expect negative).
Magnitude context: compute predicted change for a one SD decrease in median_age; compare to reported 2.5 percentage point benchmark.
Model fit consistency and robustness under year fixed effects and clustering by country.
